body: @iplusMario Is the performance significantly better when you don't use EF?
Are you opening and closing the db connection for each transaction?  That is a performance killer with sqlcipher.
@ericsink We have connection pooling by default now, so this shouldn't be an issue in a typical app.

issue.title: Performance with SQLite and Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite.Core and SQLitePCLRaw.bundle_e_sqlcipher

repository.name: SQLitePCL.raw
repository.description: A Portable Class Library (PCL) for low-level (raw) access to SQLite

issue.body:
We are currently testing encrypted SQLite and we are experiencing slow performance (500 ms for commiting transaction) when inserting into database.
Any idea what could be causing this slow performance on encrypted SQLite database?


Include provider and version information
EF Core version: 6.0 and SQLitePCLRaw.bundle_e_sqlcipher 2.1.0
Database provider: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite.Core 6.0.8
Target framework: (e.g. .NET Core 6.0)
Operating system: Windows 10
IDE: (e.g. Visual Studio 2022)

body: Hmm, I thought we had an issue to investigate this, but I can't seem to find it.

My theory is that sending the `PRAGMA key` statement again after we retrieve the internal connection from the pool is causing it to re-derive the encryption key making it just as slow as before pooling. Sending `PRAGMA key` shouldn't be required in this situation and we should avoid sending it.

We have now tried encrypting the SQLite database with SQLitePCLRaw.bundle_zetetic 2.1.0 and the zetetic-sqlcipher-windows 4.5.2 driver. 
We noticed in the logs that the connection to the database is not terminated after each query execution. 
If you look at the log above, you will see that the connection is terminated after each query execution.

Include provider and version information
EF Core version: 6.0
Database provider: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite.Core 6.0.8, SQLitePCLRaw.bundle_zetetic 2.1.0 and zetetic-sqlcipher-windows 4.5.2
Target framework: NET Core 6.0
Operating system: Windows 10
IDE: Visual Studio 2022

Confirmed. Re-sending `PRAGMA key` is slowing it waaaay down. I'll prepare a fix and discuss with the team whether we should patch 6.0.

/cc @james1301 @LauraLaura (Sorry it took so long to investigate this.)

issue.title: Microsoft.Data.Sqlite: Avoid re-initialization of pooled connections

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.title: [6.0.x] Avoid re-sending PRAGMA KEY on pooled SQLite connections

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body: We should consider porting (at least part of) the fix for #28774 to 6.0.

body: Thanks @bricelam, any outcome about patching 6.0? Would be a big boost
